channel.title: US Army: Dragonhide Armor Sucks!
channel.description:
Army Says Dragon Skin Armor Falls Short
WASHINGTON -- The U.S. Army, in a rare move Monday, released a barrage of test results showing that a privately-sold flexible body armor that some families have sought for their soldiers failed extensive military testing.
Pieces of the hefty Dragon Skin armor, with ragged holes torn through its yellow inner skin, were propped up on the floor in the Pentagon, as Army officials systematically detailed the battery of ammunition and temperature testing the armor failed.
http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2007/05/21/AR2007052101297.html

no. its loadsa peices or new stuff (forget what it is) and its put together so its like dragonhide, (each peice overlaps the other and in the shape of scales) It reduces kinectic energy on the soldier spreading the impact energy out ratherthen what the kevlar vest does at the moment (all energy where bullet its)

Can also stop a 7.62 steel capped round ( i think its that mm) the ak47 uses

item.title: US Army: Dragonhide Armor Sucks!
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:12, topic:98677”][quote author=Bebemycat2 link=topic=141843.msg1359948#msg1359948 date=1179881938]
I have actually watched a show when they “tested” the dragon skin armor, and it looked more promising then the modern Kevlar vests.

But really the testing we most likely rushed due to public pressure. Face it, many American’s as well as people from the international community are pressuring Washington because they went to war with 'ill equipped troops. Now there is a rush, still after several years, to get armor to the troops and to stop the 10+ deaths each week.

That is still no excuse though. I think this is just another blunder in a rapidly expanding list.
[/quote]

Future Weapons on Discovery Ch?[/quote]

Yep that program owns.

Read full topic
